definitions.definition: The act of flowing; a continuous moving on or passing by, as of a flowing stream.

examples: The schedule is in flux at the moment.
Languages, like our bodies, are in a continual flux .

definitions.definition: A chemical agent for cleaning metal prior to soldering or welding .
examples: It is important to use flux when soldering or oxides on the metal will prevent a good bond.

definitions.definition: The rate of transfer of energy (or another physical quantity), especially an electric or magnetic field , through a given surface.
examples: That high a neutron flux would be lethal in seconds.

definitions.definition: A disease which causes diarrhea , especially dysentery .
Diarrhea or other fluid discharge from the body.
The state of being liquid through heat; fusion .

main_definition: The act of flowing; a continuous moving on or passing by, as of a flowing stream.
secondary_definitions: A chemical agent for cleaning metal prior to soldering or welding .
( physics ) The rate of transfer of energy (or another physical quantity), especially an electric or magnetic field , through a given surface.
( archaic ) A disease which causes diarrhea , especially dysentery .
( archaic ) Diarrhea or other fluid discharge from the body.
The state of being liquid through heat; fusion .
